Standard#

class abcmodel.land_surface.standard.StandardLandSurfaceInitConds(alpha, wg, w2, temp_soil, temp2, surf_temp, wl, rs=1000000.0, rssoil=1000000.0, cliq=nan, temp_soil_tend=nan, wgtend=nan, wltend=nan, le_veg=nan, le_liq=nan, le_soil=nan, le=nan, hf=nan, gf=nan, le_pot=nan, le_ref=nan, ra=nan)[source]#

Bases: object

Standard land surface model initial state.

alpha: float#

Slope of the light response curve [mol J-1].

wg: float#

Soil moisture content in the root zone [m3 m-3].

w2: float#

Soil moisture content in the deep layer [m3 m-3].

temp_soil: float#

Soil temperature [K].

temp2: float#

Deep soil temperature [K].

surf_temp: float#

Surface temperature [K].

wl: float#

Liquid water storage on the canopy [m].

rs: float = 1000000.0#

Surface resistance [m s-1].

rssoil: float = 1000000.0#

Soil resistance [m s-1].

cliq: float = nan#

Wet fraction of the canopy [-].

temp_soil_tend: float = nan#

Soil temperature tendency [K s-1].

wgtend: float = nan#

Soil moisture tendency [m3 m-3 s-1].

wltend: float = nan#

Canopy water storage tendency [m s-1].

le_veg: float = nan#

Latent heat flux from vegetation [W m-2].

le_liq: float = nan#

Latent heat flux from liquid water [W m-2].

le_soil: float = nan#

Latent heat flux from soil [W m-2].

le: float = nan#

Total latent heat flux [W m-2].

hf: float = nan#

Sensible heat flux [W m-2].

gf: float = nan#

Ground heat flux [W m-2].

le_pot: float = nan#

Potential latent heat flux [W m-2].

le_ref: float = nan#

Reference latent heat flux [W m-2].

ra: float = nan#

Aerodynamic resistance [s m-1].

class abcmodel.land_surface.standard.AbstractStandardLandSurfaceModel(a, b, p, cgsat, wsat, wfc, wwilt, c1sat, c2ref, lai, gD, rsmin, rssoilmin, cveg, wmax, lam)[source]#

Bases: AbstractLandSurfaceModel

Abstract standard land surface model with comprehensive soil-vegetation dynamics.

This class serves as a base, defining the parameters, core logic, and integration steps for a standard land surface model. It handles the surface energy balance, soil physics, and prognostic updates.

It requires concrete implementations for the compute_surface_resistance and compute_co2_flux methods, which are specific to the chosen vegetation/carbon model.

run(state, const, surface_layer)[source]#

Run the full land surface model for one time step.

Parameters:

  • state (PyTree)

  • const (PhysicalConstants)

  • surface_layer (AbstractSurfaceLayerModel)

Returns:

The updated state object.

Notes

The order of execution is:

  1. compute_ra()

  2. compute_thermodynamics()

  3. compute_surface_resistance()

  4. compute_co2_flux()

  5. compute_soil_resistance()

  6. compute_wet_canopy_fraction()

  7. compute_skin_temperature()

  8. compute_surface_fluxes()

  9. compute_reference_fluxes()

  10. compute_prognostic_tendencies()

  11. compute_kinematic_fluxes()

integrate(state, dt)[source]#

Integrate the model forward one time step (Euler forward).

Updates the prognostic variables (soil temperature, soil moisture, canopy water) using the tendencies calculated in the run step.

Parameters:

  • state (PyTree)

  • dt (float) time step [s].

Returns:

The state with updated prognostic variables.

Returns:

The state with updated surface resistance.

abstractmethod compute_co2_flux(state, const)[source]#

Calculate the CO2 flux (e.g., GPP, NEE) for the surface.

Parameters:

  • state (PyTree)

  • const (PhysicalConstants)

Returns:

The state with updated CO2 flux values.

compute_thermodynamics(state)[source]#

Calculate saturated vapor pressure esat, saturated specific humidity qsat, the derivative dqsatdT, and vapor pressure e.

Parameters:

state (PyTree)

Returns:

The state with updated thermodynamic properties.

Notes

The derivative of saturated vapor pressure, \(e_{\text{sat}}\), with respect to temperature \(T\) (in Kelvin) is derived from the August-Roche-Magnus formula

\[e_{\text{sat}} = 611 \cdot \exp(f(T_C)),\]

where \(T_C = T - 273.16\):

\[f(T_C) = \frac{17.2694 \cdot T_C}{T_C + 237.3} = \frac{17.2694 \cdot (T - 273.16)}{T - 35.86}\]

Using the quotient rule, the derivative \(f'(T)\) is:

\[f'(T) = \frac { 17.2694 \cdot (T - 35.86) - 17.2694 \cdot (T - 273.16) } { (T - 35.86)^2 }\]

This implementation simplifies the numerator, giving:

\[\frac{de_{\text{sat}}}{dT} = e_{\text{sat}} \cdot f'(T)\]

The derivative of specific humidity, \(q_{\text{sat}}\), is then found using \(q_{\text{sat}} \approx 0.622 \cdot e_{\text{sat}} / P\):

\[\frac{dq_{\text{sat}}}{dT} \approx \frac{0.622}{P} \frac{de_{\text{sat}}}{dT}\]
compute_soil_resistance(state)[source]#

Calculates the soil resistance for evaporation.

Parameters:

state (PyTree)

Returns:

The state with updated soil resistance.

Notes

A soil moisture stress factor, \(f_2\), is calculated based on the root-zone soil moisture \(w_g\) relative to the wilting point \(w_{wilt}\) and field capacity \(w_{fc}\):

\[f_2 = \frac{w_{fc} - w_{wilt}}{w_g - w_{wilt}}\]

The soil resistance \(r_{s,soil}\) is then the minimum resistance scaled by this factor:

\[r_{s,soil} = r_{s,soil,min} \cdot f_2\]
compute_wet_canopy_fraction(state)[source]#

Calculates the fraction of the canopy that is wet.

Parameters:

state (PyTree)

Returns:

The state updated with the wet canopy fraction.

compute_skin_temperature(state, const)[source]#

Calculates the surface skin temperature implicitly.

Parameters:

  • state (PyTree)

  • const (PhysicalConstants)

Returns

The state updated with the skin temperature.

Notes

This function solves the surface energy balance for the surface temperature \(T_{\text{surf}}\). The energy balance is:

\[R_{\text{net}} - G = H + LE\]

where \(G\), \(H\), and \(LE\) are all functions of \(T_{\text{surf}}\). The latent heat \(LE\) is partitioned into vegetation, soil, and wet canopy fractions.

By linearizing the equations for \(H\) and \(LE\) with respect to \(T_{\text{surf}}\), we can rearrange the balance into the form \(T_{\text{surf}} = \text{Numerator} / \text{Denominator}\). This is an implicit solution that avoids iterative solving.

compute_surface_fluxes(state, const)[source]#

Calculates all surface energy fluxes using the new skin temperature.

Parameters:

  • state (PyTree)

  • const (PhysicalConstants)

Returns

The state updated with surface fluxes.

Notes

The latent heat fluxes (\(LE\)) and sensible heat flux (\(H\)) are calculated using bulk-aerodynamic formulas based on the difference between the surface and the air, linearized using \(dq_{\text{sat}}/dT\):

\[LE = \frac{\rho \cdot L_v}{r_a + r_s} \left[ \frac{dq_{\text{sat}}}{dT}(T_{\text{surf}} - \theta) + (q_{\text{sat}}(\theta) - q) \right]\]

Similar forms are used for \(LE_{\text{veg}}\), \(LE_{\text{liq}}\), and \(LE_{\text{soil}}\) using their respective resistances.

Sensible heat flux \(H\): .. math:

H = \frac{\rho \cdot c_p}{r_a} (T_{\text{surf}} - \theta)

Ground heat flux \(G\): .. math:

G = \lambda (T_{\text{surf}} - T_{\text{soil}})
compute_reference_fluxes(state, const)[source]#

Calculates potential and reference evaporation (Penman-Monteith).

Parameters:

  • state (PyTree) Current state of the model.

  • const (PhysicalConstants) Physical constants.

Returns:

Updated state with reference fluxes.

Returns:

compute_kinematic_fluxes(state, const)[source]#

Converts energy fluxes (W/m^2) to kinematic fluxes (K m/s, kg/kg m/s).

Parameters:

  • state (PyTree)

  • const (PhysicalConstants)

Returns:

Updated state with kinematic fluxes.
